guide.introduction: This tutorial will walk you through creating an LED Hula Hoop with a fully programmable display pattern, capable of representing any color on each individual LED. This project was adapted from the LED Beltkit created by Adafruit Industries. Most materials used in this project can be ordered from adafruit.com
guide.introduction_rendered:
This tutorial will walk you through creating an LED Hula Hoop with a fully programmable display pattern, capable of representing any color on each individual LED. This project was adapted from the LED Beltkit created by Adafruit Industries. Most materials used in this project can be ordered from adafruit.com

Relevant parts
  • Digital Addressable RGB LED w/ PWM waterproof flexi strip
  • 4-pin JST SM Plug Cable

parts.text: Digital Addressable RGB LED w/ PWM waterproof flexi strip

lines.text: 1 m LDP3306 Digitally Addressable LED Strip
lines.text_raw: 1 m LDP3306 Digitally Addressable LED Strip

lines.text: Hula Hoop tubing Poly Propelyne, or HDPE Tubing from hardware or plumbing store.  The project used 108" of tubing 3/4" outer diameter
lines.text_raw: Hula Hoop tubing Poly Propelyne, or HDPE Tubing from hardware or plumbing store.  The project used 108" of tubing 3/4" outer diameter

lines.text: 4-pin JST SM Receptacle Cable x4
4-pin JST SM Plug Cable x4

guide.summary: This is a Hula Hoop with 32 Digitally Addressable RGB LEDs with user replaceable rechargeable NiMH batteries.  LEDs are controlled with a Teensy 2.0 Arduino.
guide.title: Programmable 32 LED Hula Hoop
